body_html:
I don't think anyone is actively working on the IR emitter versions of dot and conv. Contributions welcome! I think it would be a fun project!

If the dot and conv IR emitters were more competitive, it would open new optimization opportunities (e.g., fusions into the dot kernels). But it is not easy to match the performance of hand-tuned dot and conv kernels via LLVM. It seems more tractable to do so on CPU rather than GPU, due to the limitations like the lack of control over register allocation in NVidia's PTX.

(In the short term, we are probably going to look into replacing or augmenting Eigen with libxsmm or MKL for dot and conv on CPU.)
